title: The Browsing Company’s unconventional browser Arc releases publicly on Mac
description: It's still based on Chromium, but the user experience is quite different.

title: World’s heaviest commercial communications satellite will launch tonight
description: SpaceX will again launch a competitor's satellite, this time a 10-ton behemoth.

title: The Namibian fairy circle debate rages on: Could it be sand termites after all?
description: Study offers four-point rebuttal to 2022 claim that they're a kind of eco-Turing pattern.

title: The US government is taking a serious step toward space-based nuclear propulsion
description: "NASA is looking to go to Mars with this system."

title: Google says it will start downranking non-tablet apps in the Play Store
description: Google's push for big screens will include a (hopefully dramatic) Play Store redesign.

title: OpenAI discontinues its AI writing detector due to “low rate of accuracy”
description: Research shows that any AI writing detector can be defeated—and false positives abound.

title: Man open-sources the self-repairable AirPods Pro case that Apple won’t make
description: The AirPods Pro "could have been easily made repairable with minimal effort."

title: Dealmaster: Save on laptops, vacuums, and back-to-school supplies
description: From pens and school supplies to laptops, save on your back-to-school shopping list.

title: Windows, hardware, Xbox sales are dim spots in a solid Microsoft earnings report
description: Company also expects to spend ever more money to support its ongoing AI efforts.

title: Twitter commandeers @X username from man who had it since 2007
description: Twitter took Gene X Hwang's username and only offered him “some merch”

title: Boeing has now lost $1.1 billion on Starliner, with no crew flight in sight
description: "We're not really ready to talk about a launch opportunity yet."

title: Nissan and Renault revamp alliance with $663 million EV investment
description: The 24-year alliance started to fray with the arrest of Carlos Ghosn in 2019.

title: Pocket assistant: ChatGPT comes to Android
description: OpenAI brings the popular AI language model to an official Android client app.

title: BMW uses autonomous cars for boring, repetitive tests
description: Forget robotaxis, this is for precision and repeatability.

title: BMW’s valet parking test trades red vests for remote driving rigs
description: So, who do you tip?

title: Seven major automakers to build EV charging network with 30,000 chargers
description: The chargers will support both CCS1 and NACS, with deployment starting in 2024.

title: Samsung makes the Galaxy Z Fold 5 and Z Flip 5 official
description: Samsung has a new fold-flat hinge, gives the Z flip a bigger screen.

title: Major AI companies form group to research, keep control of AI
description: Skeptics say Anthropic, Google, Microsoft and OpenAI hope to avoid regulation.

title: How we host Ars Technica in the cloud, part two: The software
description: A deep dive into the applications and functions that keep Ars humming along in the cloud.

title: Dinosaurs and the evolution of breathing through bones
description: Dinosaurs' hyper-efficient breathing system also evolved in two other lineages.
